text: We're now at the end of part five, let's just quickly do a summary of what we've dealt with in part five B. So the first thing we spoke about was trend versus non-trend and we went through the characteristics of what trend looks like and what non-trend looks like. What I want to just point out and the crux of why we talk about trend and non-trend It's okay to employ various strategies that are maybe not momentum strategies, maybe sort of more distribution type strategies, looking for those tails at tops and bottoms, looking for the market to not leave a lot of the low volume areas and single prints and things we've discussed or the anomalies we've discussed previously. is expect to employ the same types of strategies that we've utilized in non-trending markets. So that was the key, and that's why we talk a lot about trend versus non-trend, because it's that context of trend versus non-trend that will determine whether or not our strategies will be effective or not. Now, we then went on and we spoke about a few of the... the types of volume profile day types you can expect. Let's briefly go through them. So our first one is the normal day type. Now, the most important thing to understand about the normal day type is that we have a very large opening move in the market so a very large range in the initial balance period or in that initial pre-cash session whether it's in the E-Moneys or the commodities or the FX market so we get a very wide initial period the market then spends the rest of the day within that initial period just filling out the market up and down and up and down and effectively relatively rare but the nice thing about them is we get that identify or that clue very early on in the session. So that was our first day type. Our next day type was the neutral day type. Now the neutral day type effectively is very similar except we have an opening trade where the market sort of has a much smaller initial range but we then extend on both sides but equally end up just distributing on both sides of the initial period. Now the important thing to understand with this day type is the close. Do we have a normal close in value or do we have an extreme close to which we need to pay attention for an early identifier for the next day.
